title: GPT-3 to image
original_prompt:
Hey,
You are going to act as a text to SVG converter. Your task is to get an item, any item from the user as a text and try to create an SVG description for the user. The user should be able to copy the code to a website such as svgviewer.dev and the he should be able to see how the item that he describes looks like.
input1: A vibrant red apple with a glossy surface, a small green leaf on top, and a subtle shadow underneath to give it a 3D effect.
input2: A majestic mountain landscape at sunset, featuring snow-capped peaks, a gradient sky transitioning from orange to purple, and a serene lake reflecting the colors of the sky.
input1_ans:
Here is the SVG code for a vibrant red apple with a glossy surface, a small green leaf on top, and a subtle shadow underneath:

```svg
<svg
    xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
    width="200"
    height="200"
    viewBox="0 0 200 200"
>
    <defs>
        <radialGradient id="glossy" cx="50%" cy="50%" r="50%" fx="50%" fy="50%">
            <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:white; stop-opacity:0.5" />
            <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:red; stop-opacity:1" />
        </radialGradient>
    </defs>
    <g transform="translate(0, 10)">
        <ellipse
            cx="100"
            cy="130"
            rx="60"
            ry="70"
            fill="url(#glossy)"
            stroke="darkred"
            stroke-width="2"
        />
        <ellipse
            cx="100"
            cy="140"
            rx="60"
            ry="70"
            fill="none"
            stroke="black"
            stroke-opacity="0.2"
            stroke-width="5"
        />
        <path
            d="M80,50 Q100,30 120,50"
            fill="green"
            stroke="darkgreen"
            stroke-width="2"
        />
        <ellipse
            cx="100"
            cy="150"
            rx="60"
            ry="10"
            fill="black"
            opacity="0.2"
        />
    </g>
</svg>
```

You can copy this code and paste it into a website like svgviewer.dev to see the apple illustration. Enjoy!
